member.name: T:C1.Chart.Standard.ErrorBar
member.summary: Represents an ErrorBar series of
member.remarks: The series helps you see margins of error and standard deviations at a glance. They can be shown as a standard error amount, a percentage, or a standard deviation. You can also set your own values to display the exact error amounts you want.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the direction of the error.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the end style of the series.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the error amount of the series.

member.name: P:C1.Chart.Standard.ErrorBar.CustomPlusErrorValue
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the custom plus error value.
member.remarks: If ErrorAmount is ErrorAmount.Custom, the value will be used.

member.name: P:C1.Chart.Standard.ErrorBar.CustomMinusErrorValue
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the cumstom minus error value.
member.remarks: If ErrorAmount is ErrorAmount.Custom, the value will be used.

member.name: P:C1.Chart.Standard.ErrorBar.ErrorValue
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the error value of the series.
member.remarks: This property should be work with errorAmount property. If errorAmount is ErrorAmount.FixedValue, the value property is a fixed number value. If errorAmount is ErrorAmount.Percentage, the value property is a percentage number value between 0 and 1. If errorAmount is ErrorAmount.StandardDeviation, the value property is a percentage number of calculated standard deviation value.

member.summary: Gets the style of the error bar.

member.name: T:C1.Chart.Serialization.ChartModel
member.summary:
The ChartModel class is used by the FlexChart serializer to serialize and deserialize FlexChart based controls.
Serialization is performed using the FlexChart core interfaces. Deserialization is peformed using the platform instances of the FlexChart control.

member.name: M:C1.Chart.Serialization.ChartModel.#ctor
member.summary: Simple constructor used to create an instance of the ChartModel class during deserialization.

member.name: M:C1.Chart.Serialization.ChartModel.#ctor(C1.Chart.IChart,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Overloaded constructor used create an instance of the ChartModel class during serialization. The public properties of this class are set by this contructor as they are obtained from the IChart interface object passed as the parameter.
member.param: Specifies the IChart interface object to be serialized.
Specifies whether the data source should be serialized.
member.remarks: The ChartModel class contains as serializable properties all other FlexChart objects appropriate for serializing the FlexChart control, it is only necessary to request serialization of the IChart object to store all information about the chart. Subobjects do need not be serialized separately.

member.name: M:C1.Chart.Serialization.ChartModel.Load(C1.Chart.IChart,C1.Chart.Serialization.ChartModel)
member.summary: ChartModel.Load is used to set the properties of an existing FlexChart object in a FlexChart based control. The values used are those stored in an existing ChartModel class object that is typically created and set by a standard serializer during deserialization.
member.param: Specifies an existing instance of a FlexChart class object.
Specifies an existing instannce of a ChartModel class object created by a a standard serializer during deserialization.

member.name: T:C1.Chart.DateTimeGroupProvider
member.summary: Provides basic groups for DateTime values that extend beyond one month. Although default groups are provided, explicit selection of the groups and format are possible.

member.name: M:C1.Chart.DateTimeGroupProvider.#ctor
member.summary: This contstructor allows automatic generation of groups based upon the axis range.

member.name: M:C1.Chart.DateTimeGroupProvider.#ctor(C1.Chart.IAxis)
member.summary: This constructor allows automatic generation of groups based upon the axis range and the axis MajorUnit value.

member.name: M:C1.Chart.DateTimeGroupProvider.GetLevels(C1.Chart.IRange)
member.summary: As the first method called by FlexChart, this method provides the number of group levels provided by the class.
member.param: Specifies the full range of the axis data.

member.name: P:C1.Chart.DateTimeGroupProvider.GroupTypes
member.summary: Gets the collection of group specifiers using the TimeUnits enumeration. The index of each specifier indicates (level-1). Specifiers modified using the collection Add, Insert and Remove methods of the collection. If no values are specified, values are automatically selected based on the range.

member.name: P:C1.Chart.DateTimeGroupProvider.GroupFormats
member.summary:
Get a dictionary of formats keyed by the TimeUnits enum of each group. Each value specifies the string.Format() of the numeric value followed by the year, with the exception of TimeUnits.Month for which the format specifies either all "M" characters (for the month name) or the numeric value of the month and year. Note if {1} is not included in the format, the year is not included.
Default formats are Day="{0}", Week="Week {0}, Month="MMM", Quarter="Q{0}", "Year="{0}".

member.name: M:C1.Chart.DateTimeGroupProvider.GetRanges(C1.Chart.IRange,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a list of IRange values for the level specified the by the appropriate entry in the GroupTypes collection.
member.param: Specifies the full range of the axis.
Specifies the level of IRange values for the level specified by the appropriate entry in the GroupTypes collection.

The size of the wick line is determined by the High and Low values, while the size of the bar is determined by the Open and Close values. The bar is displayed using different colors, depending on whether the close value is higher or lower than the open value.

If ErrorAmount is ErrorAmount.Percentage, the value property is a percentage number value between 0 and 1. If ErrorAmount is ErrorAmount.StandardDeviation, the value property is a percentage number of calculated standard deviation value.

member.name: T:C1.Chart.Easing
member.summary: Specifies easing function. Sets the timing function for the animation.

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.Linear
member.summary: Same speed from start to finish.

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.Swing
member.summary: It provides move or cause to move back and forth or from side to side while suspended or on an axis to an element.

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.ExpIn
member.summary: The animation starts slowly, accelerates towards the end using the formula f(t) = Math.Pow(2, 10 * t - 10).

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.ExpOut
member.summary: The animation starts quickly and slows down towards the end using the formula f(t) = 1 - Math.Pow(2, -10 * t).

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.ExpInOut
member.summary: The animation starts and ends slowly by exponential function.

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.BackIn
member.summary: The animation goes past the start and then accelerates as it reaches the end.

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.BackOut
member.summary: The animation starts fast, then slows and goes past the end where s = 1.70158, using the formula f(t) = --t * t * ((s + 1) * t + s) + 1.

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.BackInOut
member.summary: Starts the animation slowly as it overshoots in the start, then accelerates quickly before it slows and overshoots the end.

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.BounceIn
member.summary: The bouncing animation, when it starts slowly, accelerates towards the end using the formula f(t) = 1 - BounceOut(1 - t).

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.BounceOut
member.summary: The bouncing animation, when it starts quickly and slows down towards the end.

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.BounceInOut
member.summary: The bouncing animation, when it starts and ends slowly.

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.CircleIn
member.summary: The animation uses an easing function that creates an animation that accelerates using the formula f(t) = 1 - Math.Sqrt(1 - t * t).

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.CircleOut
member.summary: The animation uses an easing function that creates an animation that decelerates using the formula f(t) = Math.Sqrt(1 - --t * t).

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.CircleInOut
member.summary: The animation uses an easing function, which creates a slow start and end for the animation.

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.CubicIn
member.summary: Represents an easing function that creates an animation that accelerates using the formula f(t) = t * t * t.

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.CubicOut
member.summary: Represents an easing function that creates an animation that decelerates using the formula f(t) = --t * t * t + 1.

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.CubicInOut
member.summary: Represents an easing function that creates an animation that decelerates using the formula f(t) = ((t *= 2) <= 1 ? t * t * t : (t -= 2) * t * t + 2) / 2.

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.ElasticIn
member.summary: Represents an Ease function that creates an accelerating animation that resembles a spring that vibrates back and forth until it stops.

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.ElasticOut
member.summary: Represents a ease function that creates a spring-like slowing animation that oscillates back and forth until it stops.

member.name: F:C1.Chart.Easing.ElasticInOut
member.summary: Represents a decelerate function that creates an animation that accelerates and decelerates, and resembles a spring that oscillates back and forth until it stops.

member.name: M:C1.Util.IRendering.DrawPath(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Draws a path defined by points and types and fill.
member.param: The path types to draw (see remarks).
Whether is closed path (figure) or not.
member.remarks: Path types: 0x00: the start of a figure 0x01: one of the two endpoints of a line 0x02: an endpoint or control point of a Quadratic Bzier (two points) 0x03: an endpoint or control point of a Bzier (three points) 0x80: the last point of a figure 0x81: the last point of the figure in a closed sub path (one point) 0x82: the last point of the figure for Quadratic Bzier curve of the figure in a closed sub path (two points) 0x83: the last point of the figure for Bzier curve of the figure in a closed sub path (three points)
